content:
User: It is saved properly. jesse@DESKTOP-13JMJ93 MINGW64 /c/AI-Execution-System/deployment/terraform (temp-orphan) $ terraform plan ╷ │ Warning: Available Write-only Attribute Alternative │ │   with google_secret_manager_secret_version.openai_api_key_version, │   on main.tf line 51, in resource "google_secret_manager_secret_version" "openai_api_key_version": │   51:   secret_data = var.openai_api_key │ │ The attribute secret_data has a write-only alternative secret_data_wo available. Use the write-only alternative of the attribute when possible. │ │ (and one more similar warning elsewhere) ╵ ╷ │ Error: Unsupported block type │ │   on main.tf line 136, in resource "google_cloud_scheduler_job" "health_check": │  136:     retry_config { │ │ Blocks of type "retry_config" are not expected here. ╵

Gemini: Add Provider Version Pinning Code: Paste the following code into versions.tf and save it:

terraform {
  required_providers {
    google = {
      source  = "hashicorp/google"
      version = "6.20.0"
    }
  }
}
Run terraform init: In Git Bash, navigate to the C:\AI-Execution-System\deployment\terraform\ directory and execute:

terraform init
Observe the output to ensure it re-initializes and uses the specified Google Provider version 6.20.0.

Run terraform plan: Immediately after terraform init, run:

terraform plan
Observe the output and check if the "Unsupported block type" error for retry_config is resolved.

Expected Outcome:

By explicitly setting the provider version to 6.20.0, we aim to resolve any potential incompatibility or bug that might be causing Terraform to incorrectly interpret the retry_config block. Hopefully, after these steps, terraform plan will run successfully without the "Unsupported block type" error.

Request to User:

After completing steps 1-4 above, please provide the complete output of both terraform init and terraform plan commands. Specifically, let me know:

Did terraform init complete successfully and indicate it's using Google Provider version 6.20.0?
Did terraform plan complete successfully without the "Unsupported block type" error for retry_config?
Are there any other errors or warnings in the terraform plan output?
Let's see if explicitly setting the provider version resolves this persistent error. We are in the final stages of debugging the Terraform configuration! LFG!
